body:
The sync percentage is defined as 

```
var pct = 100 * $scope.model[repo].inSyncBytes / $scope.model[repo].globalBytes;
```

which can only be negative if one of the byte counts are. I don't see how that would happen... Server side, the sizes in question are int64 so wrapping should not be an issue.
Can't reproduce. Please reopen with screenshot when you see it again. :)

I can reproduce this. But maybe this is intended.. ;)
![unbenannt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/4167751/0a39a11c-3516-11e4-8edc-4b80f7ca462a.PNG)

Scenario: 3 Nodes. I added a file to Node BigBear. BlackDS synced first. WhiteDS did not yet sync fully and is therefore somehow negative, when monitored from BlackDS..
Ah. I thought you meant on the repo side, so yah this clarifies. No, not intentional, since it makes no sense. :)

I found some more:
I was only syncing 1 file:
![unbenannt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/4178496/4faefea2-3699-11e4-8358-d60daf51b2f2.PNG)
Same scenario: 
Scenario: 3 Nodes. I added a file to Node BigBear. BlackDS synced first. WhiteDS did not yet sync fully and is therefore somehow negative, when monitored from _WhiteDS_..
I also saw it at the repo side. And thanks for the screenshots.
This was a symptom an underlying, worse, bug. Thanks for helping nail it down!

No problem, i am glad to help.
While testing, i found one more on this topic: I am not sure i it is fixed with your new file, of if i should open a new issue.. Please let me know if you rather prefer a new issue.

ST also shows -100% if one Node didnt connect since the added File:
![unbenannt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/4188925/587118c0-3777-11e4-80be-9d1fb17a6a9b.PNG)

I will test again, once the new .14 is out, this is tested with the released 0.9.13
With 0.9.14 it is fixed now! Thank you.

issue.title: 0.9.15 Sync progress can still show negative percentages
issue.body:
Continued from #592 (Do you normally make an new issue or use the old one? I cannot reopen the old one..)

BlackDS: 0.9.15 linux-386 default
BigBear: 0.9.15 Windows 7 64 bit
During the initial sending of the index:
![during_sending_index3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/4250044/139c68d4-3a7f-11e4-92cb-3d4f83f8d7f3.PNG)
Please also note the 235 % of CPU percentage. Is this normal?
Fine for me is the consumed RAM. 
Also the Windows side: there the 50% Sync Progress seems funny, one Repo 380 Kilobyte, the other 380 Gigabyte.. Still at 50%.. I guess this is by design.
![during_sending_index2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/4250091/b5e58062-3a7f-11e4-894a-cefbdcf4cbcb.PNG)

body:
Still seeing this in v0.11.0-beta1, attached below
![ohrgx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/562917/6962814/47eb7738-d930-11e4-846e-43ca58461731.png)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

body:
I just saw it on the device side.

![bildschirmfoto vom 2016-08-22 09-00-10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1416069/17846124/f45d64bc-6846-11e6-9e57-cbe4df8c7404.png)

Yup, I also have it on both sides.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427570/17864003/6d50ab40-689c-11e6-82c7-76cdb4d0eda1.png)

This is the one on the remote side. The other one is gone atm, but I see it popping up daily.

0.14.4 version on a Synology-box.
@juh2 and @Nasnl can you provide steps to reproduce this issue?

@uok I'll try. I've had it several times, also after de-installing and reinstalling Syncthing.

First time:
- 2 (identical) synology boxes, both with Syncthing 0.14.4
- Both on their own LAN, each LAN connected to the internet
- I used BTSync before to sync 220 GB data (without problems, by the way, but it was no longer supported by DSM 6.0)
- I connected both installations through the UUID
- I created directories on the master (Office) and had them scanning for 5 days
- I shared them to the other box (Home) and accepted them on that side
- They started syncing for about 10 days (both boxes very busy 24hrs/day, but almost no traffic). Then I was at -9%.
- Then I got frustrated and uninstalled everything.

2nd time (I still need a sync anyway and now I left BTSync, so I'll try again):
- same hardware and networks
- in the master, I have simple file versioning on, with 3 versions
- Currently, I have just one directory (homes) of 118 GB that I try to sync, now for 4 days
- I shared the directory after I left it scanning on the master until it said Up to date
- then the home installation starting syncing; first growing to 6% and then jumping to -8 or -9%
- there is is now since the last 24 hrs
- the master still indicates -8% and the 'slave' indicates 'unknown' at the moment, while indicating that the master is 'up top date'.

_Update:_ a bit later, the slave shows this (while the header says Syncing 0%)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427570/17869903/8e55852c-68b5-11e6-957b-75f72b96fbb0.png)
Master still at -8%.

Ask me anything. I'm happy to contribute, but I'm not a developer, so keep it 'simple'. ;-)
